From: Cisco IOS Configuration Fundamentals Command Reference
FuncDef: To delete a user menu from the configuration file, use the **no menu** command in global configuration mode.

ParaDef.Info: Name of the menu to delete from the configuration file.

Examples: The following example deletes the menu named Access1:
ExtraInfo: Use this command to remove any **menu** commands for a particular menu from the configuration file.As with all global configuration commands, this command will only effect the startup configuration file when you save the running configuration using the **copy running-config startup-config** EXEC command.

RelatedCmds.description: Specifies underlying commands for user menus.
Specifies the prompt for a user menu.
Specifies the text of a menu item in a user menu.
Creates a title, or banner, for a user menu.
